title: Ticket #36: Hold scheduler and local universe jobs on permanent errors
description:
NMI had a mal-formed shell script (no ‘#!/bin/sh’) submitted as a scheduler universe job. Condor repeatedly failed to execute it, getting errno 8 (Exec format error). The only indication that something was wrong was a line in the schedd log.

The local universe is a little better. Execution failure events appear in the user log and NumJobStarts increments on each failed attempt.

In both universes, it would be nice if Condor put the job on hold for failures like that we’re pretty sure are permanent.
remarks:
2009-Jan-22 11:18:30 by matt:
Is this more than just specifying (as the user) a PeriodicHold?

2009-Mar-20 12:04:47 by burnett:
Which errors qualify as permanent? 

  ...
  errno 7 is E2BIG - Argument list too long
  errno 8 is ENOEXEC - Exec format error
  ...

2009-Mar-20 12:06:02 by burnett:
Or do we just want a NumJobStarts in every Universe?

2009-Mar-20 13:08:16 by matt:
The NumJobStarts, NumShadowStarts, etc mess should be fixed. Having a well defined set of information for policy across universes is a good thing.

2009-Mar-20 16:03:17 by burnett:
Sounds good, I just wanted to get an impression of what the problem was.

2009-Mar-20 22:42:56 by tannenba:
This ticket is not about changing the attributes kept about a job like NumJobStarts and friends. Perhaps that is something that could be improved, but that is a topic for another day/ticket ;). It is about doing what the ticket says - errors that are very very likely to be non-transient should result in the job being placed on hold w/ a hold reason and a hold code. Just like we do for Vanilla Universe jobs, but fail to do for scheduler, and perhaps local as well. Wondering what errors are transient -vs- non-transient? Start with the errors already deemed non-transient in the vanilla universe. If the error would result in the job going on hold in vanilla, make certain it does so in scheduler & local universe as well.
